column4: hey I was following this howto but I can't import my public pgp key: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1146081
I just want my public key...
But this error goes silent unless I run seahorse from a shell explicitly
have you tried using the name associated with the key instead of its ID?
how?  I have been using the seahorse gui to import the key after publishing it publicly to the ubuntu key server
are you trying to download the key from the key server?
yes I just want a public version of my pgp key
you can't publish a key that you don't already have
I have my private key but I want a copy of the public key so I can email it to people etc.
when you make a private key, it also makes a public key
it should be under the "my personal keys" tab in seahorse
you can also export it in a terminal with gpg -a --export $USER
hey sorry, I went away... so I thought a public keyfile would end in .pub not .asc
also the command line code you gave me produces this:   gpg: WARNING: nothing exported
